Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I'll give you a dollar to eat this collie.

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: I'm not going to eat him for a dollar... I don't think he's a collie, either. Some kind of dog.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Watch your heads.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey. Woody. Gimme a cigarette.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Woody wouldn't give me a cigarette.  Ever notice he don't talk much?

Speaker: bum
Dialogue: Nah. they wouldn't fit.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: How do you know? You hadn't tried them on yet.

Speaker: bum
Dialogue: Nah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Gimme a dollar for them... Cost twenty new.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Why don't you see if they fit you?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I throwed enough trash for today, Cato.... I'll see you In the morning.

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Catch!

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi, I'm Kit. I'm not keeping you from anything important, am I?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I was just messing around over there, thought I'd come over and say hello to you.  What's your name? I said mine.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Holly.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Listen, Holly. you want to take a walk with me?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well. I got some stuff to say. Guess I'm kind of lucky that way. Most people don't have anything on their minds, do they?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Oh, incidentally, my last name is Carruthers. Sounds a little too much like druthers, doesn't it?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: It's okay.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, nobody asked me what I thought. They just hung it on me.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: You still in school?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Nah, I got me a job.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I don't mind getting up early, so I got a job throwing garbage... I'm not in love with the stuff, okay.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: That's my father. I got to run.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey. wait a minute. When am I going to see you again?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, I know what my daddy's going to say.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Can I be honest?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, that I shouldn't be seen with anybody that collects garbage.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, I mean there's nothing he wants to know about it... I've got to run.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Who was that?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Just some boy.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Is that going to kill the grass?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: You got some on my feet.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: What'd he want?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Just wanted to know if we needed any yardwork done... I said no, and for him not to bother us.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I used to throw trash for the City.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: You lost that one?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Wouldn't be here if I hadn't.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: What kind of work do you think you would be qualified for?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I can't think of anything at the moment... I'd like you to write me out a slip, though, proving I came down here.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Well, I think we could find you something... working cattle over at the pens.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well. what the hell. Just hope there's a breeze.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, stop the world.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Quit my job.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Great.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Just seemed like the right move... Whatcha doing?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Spanish.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Something mi trabajo.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah, well, I'm going to work as a cowboy now... Or thinking about it. It's a routine, like anything. What do you think?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, at least nobody could get on me about wearing these boots any more.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You want to go for a ride?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, I got homework.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Somebody dropped a bag on the sidewalk.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Everybody did that, the whole town'd be a mess ... Hi.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You're a redhead.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Anybody ever call you "Red"?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah, but I don't like it.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Just don't... I've got a headache.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What a nice place.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: And the flowers... Let's not pick them. They're so nice.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: It's your play.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: My stomach's growling.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: There's an old Fudgesicle over there. You want it?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Somebody else is going to get it.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I don't care.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Kids eat that kind of stuff in Korea.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Did it go the way it 'uz supposed to?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Is that all there is to it?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Gosh, what was everybody talking about?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Don't ask me.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well. I'm glad it's over... For a while I was afraid I might die before it happened... Had a wreck, some deal like that.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You see where that tree fell in the water?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah... The river must've washed the roots away... You don't care about anything I say, though.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You know what I think?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: That we should crunch our hands with this stone. That way we'd never forget what happened today.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: But it would hurt.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, that's the point, stupid.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Don't call me stupid.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay, but I'm going to keep it for a souvenir...

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Or maybe one that's lighter.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Sure is pretty.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: What'd you come out here for?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I wasn't aware there was any law against it.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You know Holly... well. she means a lot to me, sir.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You know, before I met her, nobody could ask me how I was doing with my girl. Matter of fact, I didn't really have one.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: It okay me leaning on your Willys here?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Listen. I got a lot of respect for her, sir.  That's about as good a one as I know to tell you.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Well, it's not good enough.  Just what do you think would happen to her if she stuck around with you, Kit? Guy like you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: She'd get along okay. And if she didn't, well, she could take off, just take off,  I wouldn't mind... I'd always tell people I deserved it.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: You get out of here. I don't want you hanging around any more. You understand?

Speaker: father
Dialogue: You're something.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Takes all kinds, sir.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: What're you doing?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I've got a gun here, sir. It's always a good idea to have one around.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: What do you think you're doing? Go on, get out of here.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I got it all planned... and I'm taking Holly off with me.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Okay, boy, I'm turning you over to the authorities.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: father
Dialogue: For coming onto my property... With a gun.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: No, you're not either.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Cause I can't allow it.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey... Hey, wait a minute.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Suppose I shot you. How'd that be? Huh?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You want to hear what it sounds like?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey, where you going?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Daddy... This is Holly... Are you going to be okay?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I came in the front.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: How bad off is he?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: We better call the doctor... Listen. I'll say how it happened, part I saw.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: He don't need a doctor.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You don't believe me, see for yourself.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I found a toaster.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Listen, honey. I don't want to...

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Listen, maybe we ought to tell somebody about this.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You said that once already... Too late now.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: They're not going to listen to me. You either. Are you kidding?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Suppose the neighbors heard the noise?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Wouldn't be funny... Listen, I'll be back in a while.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Oh... You want to call the police, that's fine. Just won't be so hot for me.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: My girl Holly and I have decided to kill ourselves, same way I did her dad. Big decision huh? Well, the reasons are obvious, and I don't have time to go into them right now... One thing, though... He was provoking me when I popped him. That's what it was like, a POP.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Course nobody's coming out of this thing happy, especially not us. You can't deny we've had fun, though. Which is more than I can say for some.... Mmmm. that's the end of the message. I run out of things to say... Thank you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: How you doing?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah, me too.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Take a break. Red... Life of Riley, huh?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: One of the chickens died last night.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I almost stepped on him.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: "The Kon-Tiki in motion was a little different from what it usually was in such conditions. We had become sensitive to changes in the rhythm of the logs. I thought at once of suction from the coast, which was drawing near, and was continually out on the deck and up the mast..."

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: He was nervous.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: "Time passed. At dawn, just before six, Torstein came hurrying down from the masthead. He could see a whole line of small palm- clad islands far ahead..."

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Holly!

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Get in the car, Red.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: We don't need this.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: How you doing, Cato?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Not bad.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Take that sombitch.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What you been doing?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Running this place for a fella in town. Nothing much to speak of.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I don't notice us hustling trash, either.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Where'd you get them antlers?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Oh, Cato, I want you to meet my girl, Holly Sargis.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Did you hear the one about the guy in the nuthouse that went around naked, with only a hat and gloves on, and this nurse came up to him and said, "Hey, what... You can't walk around that way," and the guy says, "What's the matter? Nobody comes around here." Anyway, the nurse says, "What do you have the hat and gloves on for, then?" And the guy says, "Well, you never know."

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Isn't that funny?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Don't you ever get bored around here?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Sometimes. The other day, though, an old boy was plowing in the field over there, found some old Spanish coins.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: That's what he told you, huh?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What'd they look like?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Let me finish my supper.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: We're thinking of going down to Texas. Holly wants to visit some of her people down there, but after that I don't know... They say Mexico's nice.

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Kit... Maybe I'd better get a shovel.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: I'll catch up with you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I found a lid. It was laying on the ground over there.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Put that down. It's dirty.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Cato!

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: The shovel's in the truck.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Look at all this junk.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: How's he doing?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I got him in the stomach.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Is he upset?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: He didn't say anything to me about it.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Bunch of junk.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: He stole that cage. I saw him doing it.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Whatcha looking in there for? We can't afford any of that.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: That your spider in there? in that bottle?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What do you feed him?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: Oh, flies... grasshoppers when I can catch 'em.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Does he bite?

Speaker: cato
Dialogue: He never bit me.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Hi. where's Cato?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, he's gone.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Gone? ... Where?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: He said not to tell.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah, he said for you to give us a lift into town. You're the ones with the Studebaker, aren't you?

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Well, I just need to pick up something in the house.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: No... You go in there, I'll have to kill you.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Can't afford to take chances.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Let's us step out in this field here.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Nah, skip that... I'm going to have to keep an eye on you, though.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You don't mind?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What's going to happen to Jack and me?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: You have to ask Kit. He says frog, I jump.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What's your friend's name?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Jack.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: You love him?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I've got to stick by Kit... He feels trapped.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Yeah. I can imagine.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, I've felt that way, hadn't you?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay, you two, down in the cellar.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You promise to stay down there for an hour?

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You expect me to believe that?

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I'm going to shut the door.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Think I got 'em?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I'm not going down there and look.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: We're in for it now... If they catch us.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What'd you put him in there for?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You tired?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah, you look tired... Listen, honey. when all this is over, I'm going to sit down and buy you a big, thick steak.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I don't want a steak.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, we'll see about that... Hey, lookie.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: They're probably going to blame that on me, too, bastards.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi, I come to check the meter. My tools are in here.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Oh, this Is Holly. She's from Texas.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: This your place?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Sorry to barge in on you. Anybody else here besides you two?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Good deal... Oh, uh, we're on the run and we'd like to hang out here for a while. Couple of hours, maybe. How'd that be?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Stay as long as you like.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Next time I ring that, it means time to clear out.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Listen to your parents and teachers. They got a line on most things, so don't treat them like enemies. There's always a chance you could learn something.  Excuse the grammar.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Hi... Kit's downstairs playing with the dictaphone... Sometimes he acts like there's something wrong with his bean.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Hope nothing ever goes wrong with mine.

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Think he's crazy, huh?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I don't know... He's kind of odd.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Gosh, I like your house.

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: visitor
Dialogue: Hi... ah, Mister Scarborough here?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah, but the thing about him, he's down with the flu. He's sick.

Speaker: visitor
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah. I'd invite you inside, except it's contagious. Don't want to start an epidemic.

Speaker: visitor
Dialogue: No, of course not. It's only that he called last night and asked if I could come by.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, he didn't have it last night.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: visitor
Dialogue: Well, I'd like to leave a message, if that's okay.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You have to excuse me now. I have to go back inside. Bye.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: We're out of here, Tex.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi, whatcha doing?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Just thinking.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Good a way to kill time as any... She okay?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Listen, ah ... We're going to take the Cadillac for a while. How'd that be?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Don't worry, I won't let her drive.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay, ma'am, let's go . . . come on.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You're my friend, aren't you?

Speaker: rich man
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay, no monkey business then.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Groceries.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: That guy could sell that list I gave him as a sample of my handwriting.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, why you always walking behind me?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Don't.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Anybody ever done that to you before?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Positive?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Guess there's no way I'll ever know. For sure.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: That guy must pay through the nose to keep this place up... Lawn, the gas and electric... Bagworms. Plus the upkeep on the cars... Yeah, you get a little money in your pocket, you think all your problems are solved. Well, let me tell you, they're not.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I'd like to get out of here.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Soon as I start the car... and fix my hat.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: "Rumor Pat Boone is seriously considering giving up his career so he can return to school full-time and complete his education. Fact Pat has told intimates that so long as things are going well for his career, it's the education that will have to take the back seat."

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I don't blame him.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: "Rumor Frank Sinatra and Rita Hayworth are in love... Fact True, but not with each other."

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: That's Montana over there.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I never been to Montana... Acquaintance of mine has, but I hadn't... Never had any reason to.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: State bird's a meadowlark.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Well, I feel kind of like an animal living out here. I mean, there's no place to bathe and... no place to get anything good to eat.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I'll catch you a big trout. Soon as we get to the mountains.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Everybody loves trout.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I'm serious.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Maybe we should've tried to hop it.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: It was going too fast.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I could've pulled the car up on the tracks, slowed it down some.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, maybe we oughta be stuck here. I'm not saying that I know.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: You're crazy.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, maybe the slope here is throwing it off some. We ought to find a more flat place.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: How about over here?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Never mind. It doesn't matter... If I'm worth a damn, I'll pick the right direction. And if I'm not, well, I don't care. See what I mean?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I shouldn't expect miracles, should I?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: We'll keep on heading for that mountain... Just remember I said it wasn't such a hot idea.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I could get a job with the Mounties. The Northwest Mounties ... Hell, I got all the qualifications. I can ride, shoot and... I don't mind the cold. Fact. I kind of like the cold.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Nothing... I was just running off at the mouth... as usual.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I wasn't listening.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I was just talking about going after a job... Hey. don't lip it.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: You know... they'd probably ask to see your driver's license before they hired you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You smoke Pall Mall?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Nah, you hadn't seen me when I'm going after something, honey. Tough?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey. don't touch that... Nat King Cole.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Boy, if I could sing a song like that... I mean, if I could sing a song about the way I feel right now, it'd be a hit.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: God, what a sight... Tell me this, honey. What does a little Texas girl like yourself think of a sight like that?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Love this air.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Morning... Say, you got any gas?

Speaker: roughneck
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well. I'm sorry. sir. but we've got to ask you for it.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Just a second now. That's your truck. isn't it?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, listen. I'm going to swap you my Cadillac.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Now don't worry. You're getting a fair deal. Hell. what's the blue book value on this thing, Mildred?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Name is Carruthers. Believe I shoot people every now and then. Not that I deserve a medal.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Kit!

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Okay, friend. start running.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Git.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Boy. I had a feeling today was going to be the day... Helicopter.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: He's not coming to take us for a ride. either. Come on, let's make a run for the car.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I don't want to.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Have you got a better idea?

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: I just don't want to go.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What is wrong with you, huh?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: What is the matter with you, huh!?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Boy, I don't know what to make of you. People like you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You want a second chance, then listen. Twelve noon the Grand Coulee Dam, New Year'ss Day. 1964. You meet me there... Now you got that?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey, anybody here?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi... Say,, you got any shells for a Savage, a .300 Savage?

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Damn. I pissed all mine away shooting up bottles... You want to fill her up for me? Please?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: If you want any of that junk, it's yours.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: sheriff
Dialogue: Hold it right there.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I could've held off an army if I could've gotten behind a rock in the mountains.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: We did it, Ray.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You better not leave that Cadillac sitting out here.

Speaker: sheriff
Dialogue: Put your hands in back of your head.

Speaker: sheriff
Dialogue: Now put the other one on yourself.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You're going to give me a cauliflower ear, Sheriff.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: He should've thought about that before he got caught... Shouldn't he?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Hup!

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Think I'll take the juice?

Speaker: sheriff
Dialogue: Beats me.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Say, what kind of rifle was that you were shooting at me?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Thirty aught six.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You tossed my hat out the window.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Kit... Kit, I've got a question for you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Mmmmm.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: You like people?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: They're okay.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Then why'd you do it?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I don't know. Always wanted to be a criminal, I guess. Just not this big a one... Takes all kinds though.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: You know who that sombitch looks like?  You know, don't you?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: I'll kiss your ass if he don't look like James Dean.

Speaker: mechanic
Dialogue: How you doing there, Kit?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You think?... it's leather.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey, now here's a real prize. I must've had this about ten years. Who's going to get it?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: There you go.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: South Dakota. Where you from?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Want a comb?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Yeah, she got out of there, too.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Eddie Fisher. Who's yours?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Damn! Want a pen?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Don't you read the papers?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: No sir, I hadn't.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Hey, listen, Tom, I don't mean to tell you how to run your show here but these cuffs are pinching. What do you say now?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: I need to get your signature on some papers here, Kit.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Well, I've got to read them first. Suppose I could get a Coke while I do?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Sure thing. Come on.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You boys keep out of trouble.

Speaker: guardsman
Dialogue: Don't worry about us.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Holly's over here, Kit. if you want to see her.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: You want to give me a little slack here?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Don't worry now.. I'm going to get you off these charges... There's a whole lot of other boys out there. You're going to have a lot of fun.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Boy, we rang the bells, didn't we?

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: I'll say one thing, though... That guy with the deaf maid? He's just lucky he's not dead, too.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Course it's too bad about your dad.

Speaker: holly
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: We're going to have to sit down, and talk about that sometime.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Thank you very much, Chief Sims. Sorry if I caused you any inconvenience.

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: You didn't cause me any trouble.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Thanks anyway.

Dialogue: Well, Kit...

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Tom...

Dialogue: Good luck to you.

Speaker: kit
Dialogue: Thanks.
